title.narrative: Re-Building Justice and Peace Desk at SCBC Level

description.narrative:
Justice and peace commission was set up in 1999 by Sudan Bishops’ plenary mandating Justice and Peace department to handle national Justice and peace issues and to coordinate with Justice and peace departments at the diocesan levels in awareness creation on Justice and peace issues as well as civic education through Training of Trainers (TOT) and giving legal advice. In the South Sudan Bishops conference held on the 3rd February 2014, the National Justice and Peace department has been declared an independent body from Caritas South Sudan to be under the South Sudan Bishops Secretariat.
In principle all dioceses in South Sudan have Justice and peace department with range of different activities from one diocese to another. Currently out of the seven dioceses only Rumbek diocese have not yet Justice and Peace department operational but Wau, Tombura-Yambio, Malakal, Juba, Torit and Yei are operational.
The proposed three year funding basically is to meet the cost of Salaries, programme activities and Logistic of the Coordinator and the two staff to help rebuild this important work at this crucial moment South Sudan is undergoing.
